intro: Hieracium acroterum, commonly known as the mountain hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its bright yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green ray florets, and it produces numerous small, oval seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium acroterum is often found in rocky or grassy habitats at high elevations.
